title: Secondary – Cycle 1 – Progression of Learning - Visual Arts (2010)
subject: Arts Education

document.title: Secondary – Cycle 1 – Progression of Learning - Visual Arts (2010)

15C4DE101499410CA715606135721519.description: Describes aspects of his/her experience that are related to the procedure for appreciation, and more particularly to the strategies used (e.g. ability to reflect and make connections, to identify expressive elements, to make keen observations)

1C10F2CA0A804BCCB189A96B467965F7.description: Describes important aspects that are related to the appreciation of transforming gestures and elements of visual arts language

C44DCA384CE54E9D9022169A2AD7CC7E.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary in accordance with the prescribed terminology in the program

E540099919234FCD8538AA6E7BB26D6B.description: Justifies his/her point of view based on observations and information gathered (e.g. gestures used by the artist, impact of the colours in a media image, characteristics of the artistic period to which the art work belongs)

CEBB2A62E743426E820816F9CB57C8FC.description: Justifies his/her point of view based on his/her observations

599EABC56638470B97B94612E93FB619.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary in accordance with the prescribed terminology in the program

7ED6B961DFA74A998245986140C40D48.description: Makes connections between the elements observed and the meaning perceived (e.g. colour contrasts that can produce dramatic effects, a scene from the everyday lives of explorers that can allow the viewer to understand their wretchedness)

684F51B696D34CF9903850B101E06BE4.description: Interprets the meaning of the work or production

4C3BD574B8A8416EAB7D123D22ABE0C4.description: Interprets the meaning of the work or production

BCA4784C957643B4AE545F55885FCC89.description: Picks out manners to create traces of gestures using various materials and tools (e.g. the expressive brushstrokes in Japanese works, paint applied using palette knives in certain works of the Automatists, the juxtaposition of random objects in Dadaist works)

A7EC68FDFDAB4196B4A594EC9A78A683.description: Observes evidence of gestures used to produce the image

94D726DAB3A447F088E9BA9FBCB75175.description: Picks out methods of representing space, including perspective with overlapping and diminishing perspective (e.g. superimposition of forms to create overlapping perspective, variation of the size of elements in accordance with their distance)

5DD8F7A0DAA6498F9677A7814E354371.description: Locates the representation of elements in a two-dimensional space: perspective with overlapping

EC0DC1BA33C840EE985444F7ACF7F407.description: Picks out methods of organize elements in two- or three-dimensional space: enumeration, juxtaposition, repetition, alternation, superimposition, symmetry and asymmetry (e.g. alternation of elements to create rhythm, the dimensions of forms to highlight the elements)

B874E4D09D544E99B0EBC8FB55B277DD.description: Locates the organization of elements in a two- or three-dimensional space

A0B565BC5F1841E5AA052BEB7240B060.description: Picks out the visual effects that result from the treatment of elements of visual arts language (e.g. the texture obtained through the repetition of short lines, the repetition of tasks to create values or shading)

1FE25296B67940C39A69CF4BC5E962A4.description: Locates the visual effects obtained by using elements of visual arts language

D1E94EED68414503885819EB5C1BC67D.description: Picks out elements of visual arts language (e.g. primary colours, straight lines and purged forms in an abstract piece)

46331E38349D449A982B75ADD0BB7F88.description: Locates the elements of visual arts language related to the proposed appreciation criteria

B7E4658F5C6942E1B859389F8790A39D.description: Picks out elements that are represented from various artistic movements and periods (e.g. portrait, self-portrait, landscape, still life, scenes)

194BEA955EB243318F897BB9B4E62868.description: Observes some subject-specific elements in student productions, in works of art past and present, from here and elsewhere

D4F08ABB86194DCA85AF5298ECE0A22E.description: Describes some aspects of his/her experience that are related to the creative dynamic and more particularly with the strategies used (e.g. searching for ideas during the opening phase, applying what was learned from experimentation during the productive action phase)

888F210888194E4E80BD0EEDB57F36E5.description: Describes the important aspects of his/her experience with transforming gestures and elements of visual arts language

6A0F35ADDE284B528CB5873087E6CB0E.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary in accordance with the prescribed terminology in this program

F2538C940DA64E3B8B46ED47D17A9B38.description: Shares his/her experience of visual arts creations

A3C84161DBEF445A8EBD94B0C69CCDFC.description: Makes use of the following methods of representing space: perspective with overlapping and perspective with vanishing point[diminishing perspective]

C606930D8BB04EEEB0C85DEC35F963A6.description: Uses a method of organizing space to increase the impact of the visual message on the target audience

CFFBFE4BE3C444279175E669D0F6DA49.description: Uses the following ways of organizing space: enumeration, juxtaposition, superimposition, repetition, alternance, symmetry and asymmetry

E2A6E0E58AA64FC3AE68A8DE794D1E26.description: Visual arts language (space) and spatiotemporal organization

3832ED6B423343E089C7E098328BCD5F.description: Uses a variety of elements of visual arts language, including colours in transmitted light

385EF3ADF3BD49B396A23C821D825ADE.description: Uses a variety of elements of visual arts language

5A30896226C946E68C9F197288D0E660.description: Chooses elements of visual arts language that will engage the target audience (e.g. forms, colours, space)

11C77C2F0D174001B85F12CD4E88537C.description: Chooses elements of visual arts language based on the visual arts message and intended viewers

338489C0832B4DEAB6D91D2E6D82B563.description: Tries out different ways of using elements of visual arts language (e.g. suggesting a movement by convergence of straight lines, adding contrast or light to a digital image)

1E1CA57AAA62400CB8693165D9E8ED85.description: Experiments with elements of visual arts language: shape, line, colour, value, texture, pattern and volume

066673C5C5324AE9B029E76A81C3A5DA.description: Handles the following tools: electronic pen and graphics tablet, drawing software, nib, nib holder, scissors, scanner, digital camera, image processing software

E10C0774A89C4238A288D9B7754B33AA.description: Handles the following tools: brush, scissors, mouse and paintbrush

C9CA10A8BB314F87B611A0EA62727C0F.description: Uses transforming gestures that are suited to the materials to convey the visual message to be communicated to the target audience (e.g. promoting a clothing line on advertising posters, characterizing the surface of textiles to represent velvet, wool or jute)

0BB7F228185B4D1CBAC292D19D1861A6.description: Uses transforming gestures that clarify the visual message intended for viewers

FC6E0D624BB84E7885A3027E21C55369.description: Tries out different transforming gestures, including snipping, gluing shapes flat on a support, printing, folding, creasing, shaping, digitizing images, photographing, saving images and working on a digitized image

B53DDE5D5366484DBFCDEB7841F8671F.description: Experiments with transforming gestures such as: freehand drawing, applying coloured pigments with flat brushstrokes and varied brushstrokes, tearing, notching, cutting out, spreading glue on a surface, intaglio printing, joining and pinching a malleable material

304662797E0E45F4964C49F2B4CB85BE.description: Uses transforming gestures and elements of visual arts language according to the target audience

9899630A47D6406C830600DD452D12CC.description: Makes sketches of his/her idea (e.g. experimenting with forms, elements and sizes)

35FDED0F8EC34CB5B4507EB46B5A2F15.description: Chooses an authentic and meaningful idea among those in his/her inventory which communicates to the target audience (e.g. acknowledge the interests of the target audience)

1EBECCAE15034D1D998108A45FF74992.description: Makes an inventory of authentic ideas based on research for the stimulus for his/her multimedia creation that take into account: the message to be communicated and information on the intended viewers; the content and characteristics of the media images; the role of the cultural references and the significance of the visual codes

636E86B18BE649249F71812FEE52B1A3.description: Looks for a few ideas related to the stimulus for creation of media works, taking the message and intended viewers into account and referring to sources of information

DCDDDF3C6C2E48B7ADBADD595E8B6D9C.description: Uses ideas to create a media production

05F8C78D69284025A63946D5DBC9ECD2.description: Describes some aspects of his/her experience that are related to the creative dynamic and more particularly with the strategies used (e.g. searching for ideas during the opening phase, applying what was learned from experimentation during the productive action phase)

96FAC3CFEEA2423DACA7123A63C4A2C1.description: Describes the important aspects of his/her experience with transforming gestures and elements of visual arts language

D880D2BBDC724FD39AB0E4901AC7B510.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary in accordance with the prescribed terminology in this program

315BF8FDBF4249FABE06EEC63541A646.description: Shares his/her experience of visual arts creations

726FD35978034C83AF22D2B1D3892578.description: Makes use of the following methods of representing space: perspective with overlapping and perspective with vanishing point[diminishing perspective]

5007F4CDDEB441CA8C58BD2B2AFBFDAD.description: Uses the following ways of organizing space: enumeration, juxtaposition, superimposition, repetition, alternance, symmetry and asymmetry

67BF65CD88DE40139EA460F2C0D46F82.description: Visual arts language (space) and spatiotemporal organization

76962B3E590C44EA92E9E4442174FC4D.description: Uses a variety of elements of visual arts language, including colours in transmitted light

3A502690E1244B7F91CC4B49295026EB.description: Uses a variety of elements of visual arts language

B30FD426C648486495740D4D833D2A14.description: Tries out different ways of using elements of visual arts language (e.g. suggesting a movement by convergence of straight lines, adding contrast or light to a digital image)

C2A44D5022DE42EB8FB950D0986CA445.description: Experiments with elements of visual arts language: shape, line, colour, value, texture, pattern and volume

E8E11DD2D2D24002BCF8C93B9DA0BA37.description: Handles the following tools: electronic pen and graphics tablet, drawing software, nib, nib holder, scissors, gouge, sculpting tool (wooden modeling tool, loop, wire and ribbon tool), scanner, digital camera, image processing software

9F4756D661C1465BB3E0415F57AABEF5.description: Handles the following tools: brush, scissors, mouse and paintbrush

F2618B0876D543E89357AC21C7DF4AA1.description: Uses transforming gestures on materials that support his/her creative idea (e.g. characterization of a dwelling by adding details such as bricks, stones, slopes, shingles)

ED34BD6D67C84069A35199DC7BD3F984.description: Uses transforming gestures that clarify his/her idea

08D4E0CF503941F8B1EDD6B5CB1F2229.description: Trys out different transforming gestures, including: snipping; gluing on shapes on a support, flat or in relief; printing; hollowing; folding; creasing; shaping; assembling and balancing volumes; digitizing images and objects; photographing; saving and working on a digital image

929EC5DDB2FA4C838D2AB2AB8979A675.description: Experiments with transforming gestures such as freehand drawing, applying coloured pigments with flat brushstrokes and varied brushstrokes, tearing, notching, cutting out, spreading glue on a surface, intaglio printing, joining and pinching a malleable material

F4C5412B230848CA9244E9946D528039.description: Uses transforming gestures and elements of visual arts language

834D3EBC516F4291935CF67753F25886.description: Makes sketches of his/her idea (e.g. experimenting with forms and elements using distinct, rapid strokes with light value)

E4C5917801F342D790884A6C6A1D4C24.description: Chooses an authentic and meaningful idea among those in his/her inventory (e.g. giving a personal response to the stimulus for creation without using stereotypes or making clichés)

75A4AB2EF66D456D97767DACA256C27D.description: Makes an inventory of authentic ideas based on research for the stimulus for creation involving the content of works of art, cultural objects or media images, the styles of different artists, the characteristics of art movements, etc.

AEFFDD7B9FB94E008D893F3E2C16B47B.description: Looks for a few ideas related to the stimulus for creation while consulting sources of information

749BE9D65534493C9109A9248B5028E6.description: Uses ideas to create a visual arts work

44B4AEBA43FE432D884E06AC477B0F26.description: Places some periods and art movements in time and space (e.g. on a timeline: prehistory, antiquity, Middle Ages, Impressionism, Dadaism, Cubism)

94C03B4F66D24B008FB23369734058A1.description: Names some artistic periods (e.g. prehistory, Renaissance, contemporary)

ED70C7FC8D204D0494D9351880B4E94A.description: Visual arts repertoire and cultural references

3905AAB4FF2E476B8F3284AA900757B5.description: Identifies two methods of representing three-dimensional space on a two-dimensional support: perspective with overlapping and diminishing perspective

15EB1931EF934E42AB4B5C9FDB98F201.description: Identifies ways of representing elements in space: perspective with overlapping and perspective with vanishing point

2F8B495C268C420B869713342F895797.description: Differentiates ways of organizing elements in two- and three-dimensional space (e.g. juxtaposition and superimposition, symmetry and asymmetry)

48037ED0F387441590864757A0DF0E5D.description: Identifies ways of organizing elements in space : enumeration, juxtaposition, repetition and alternance, superimposition, symmetry and asymmetry

55D873B4EDE04648BFF6C29EB58ACF2A.description: Visual arts language and multimedia language

FFEDBC38209E4CC9BB1227DB45D1CFC6.description: Identifies various patterns (e.g. flower, striped, checkered or polka-dot patterns)

03670B6CD1FA4EACBCB0378F4C69FC51.description: Identifies a variety of textures (e.g. wood grain, textile fibres, fur)

97FD4F75E4EF46768573768BB75129C8.description: Identifies values in tones, in colours and in shades

790330320F164C1C854D5AB86D407B97.description: Identifies the colours in transmitted light, including intensity and contrast

C3D32699ACF14826929AE4C3E13B8CC1.description: Identifies in pigments: light and dark colours

874493FF1D4B4138B4E9874647FFCED9.description: Identifies in pigments: the primary, secondary, warm and cool colours

2F9E44FBC91941D3B8E34F4F9FF8E560.description: Identifies various types of lines (e.g. drawn, painted, incised and tangible)

57BE7FA41D3C4213836BF4CBA9A35FF2.description: Identifies lines, including horizontal, vertical, short, long, curved, straight, oblique, broken and circular lines

2C9CED9B7E1741C5BCEF2CBE8F003E57.description: Identifies some techniques, including printing, assembling and shaping

0D56C73254DE4884A7F208F36244C5B2.description: Identifies the following techniques: collage, drawing, modelling, painting and engraving

8D7F7794C06A4CBAB752F93A86CED89A.description: Identifies the following tools: digital camera, electronic pen, sculpting tool (wooden modeling tool; loop, wire and ribbon tool), gouge , scanner , nib, nib holder , graphics tablet

D83EC3832C1D407CB253B290EC0EDE2A.description: Identifies the following tools: brush, scissors, mouse and paintbrush

CAD12428846243F78EADC406C6337072.description: Identifies some materials (e.g. felt pen, gouache, oil pastel, India ink, coloured ink)

3965CD2C9D554F9DAA2262F78D43BF6F.description: Identifies the following materials: wax crayon , felt pen, gouache, paper and cardboard, oil pastel, modelling clay, clay, charcoal and dry pastel

16856B75EDA34132BE76F3BBC206F532.description: Identifies some transforming gestures, including snipping, applying coloured pigments, assembling, notching, balancing, engraving, incising, shaping, photographing, pinching, digitizing, joining, freehand drawing, intaglio printing

24794BEDDD8746E481057EEAD88E7692.description: Identifies the following transforming gestures: gluing, tearing, cutting out, drawing, printing, modelling, painting and engraving
